column4: Hey I have an issue I have been trying to resolve for a while now and have done some searching but I'm not sure exactly what I'm looking for, can anyone help me out?
how do we know?
you need to ask the question! ;)
what exactly did you do to "switch" ?
np
it's /etc/init.d/gdm start
it'll start the login manager
then you login
thanks again ill let you know if that works
I doubt it, but who knows
did you run it with sudo ?
yeah, it needs root privileges
sorry
same error sayings gdm isn't my default desktop manager
weird
when I try it I get something quite different (it tries to start gdm)
even if I run it as myself
no, but that might not be anything to do with it
when I did it there was a README file that said stick it in the /blah/blah/plugins directory
so look for one that has 'plugins' on the end ofit
no probs
